chunks.zh: 技术人的目标和终点在哪里?
chunks.en: Where are the goals and endpoints for tech people?

chunks.zh:
过年回家，得以和其他行业的亲友交流。发现年龄焦虑普遍没有 IT 行业严重，过得也更随心所欲，更谈不上什么职业规划。

但回到大城市，自然会被一股焦虑感裹挟。
chunks.en:
When I went home for the Chinese New Year, I had the opportunity to communicate with relatives and friends in other industries. I found that age anxiety is generally not as severe as in the IT industry, and people live more freely and don't even talk about career planning.

But when I return to the big city, I am naturally swept up in a wave of anxiety.

chunks.zh: 身边的同行在这两年也都很坎坷，甚至有研究生同事年纪大了，去卖房子。
chunks.en: My colleagues around me have also had a lot of ups and downs in the past two years. Some graduate school colleagues are even selling houses because they are getting older.

chunks.zh:
我们这行的目标在哪里？刚入行时心潮彭拜，想成为知名技术人，但逐渐被现实打脸。

如果 35 是个槛，现在还拼命卷技术的意义在哪里？大家对未来有什么远景
chunks.en:
Where is the goal of our industry? When I first joined the industry, I was very excited and wanted to become a well-known tech person, but I was gradually slapped in the face by reality.

If 35 is a threshold, what is the point of desperately pushing technology now? What are everyone's visions for the future?

chunks.zh: 混口饭吃而已，面试吹牛归吹牛，骗骗别人可以，别把自己也骗了
chunks.en: Just making a living. Boasting in interviews is just boasting. You can deceive others, but don't deceive yourself.

chunks.zh: 因为别人都是过一年算一年，新年怎么样到时候再看。
chunks.en: Because other people take it one year at a time, and see how the New Year goes when the time comes.

chunks.zh: 比如大部分农民目标除了养大孩子就是混够十五年社保。
chunks.en: For example, the goal of most farmers is to raise their children and get enough fifteen years of social security.

chunks.zh: 你焦虑是因为你想要的比他们多。
chunks.en: You are anxious because you want more than them.

chunks.zh: 这不是咱们的问题, 是 国内这么多年来不顾 "低社会健康状况" 并追求"高速发展" 发展带来的问题.
chunks.en: This is not our problem, but the problem brought about by China's pursuit of 'high-speed development' for so many years, regardless of 'low social health'.

chunks.zh: 攒钱/攒技术 往出走,  日本/新加坡/欧洲各国/澳洲/美洲, 能去的地方很多.
chunks.en: Save money/accumulate technology and go abroad. There are many places to go, such as Japan/Singapore/European countries/Australia/America.

chunks.zh: 虽然过去后不代表 所有的问题就会消失, 但那里整体社会发展的"健康度"是远高于国内的.
chunks.en: Although going there does not mean that all problems will disappear, the overall 'health' of social development there is much higher than in China.

chunks.zh: 安稳后整体生活状况会远好于国内, 更何况, 孩子以后就再也不用受国内这"发展病"的影响, 可以快乐得多的成长, 这可能也是很多人的人生目标吧.
chunks.en: After settling down, the overall living conditions will be much better than in China. What's more, children will no longer be affected by China's 'development disease' in the future, and can grow up much happier. This may be the life goal of many people.

chunks.zh: @wu67 是的，在古代，我们充其量是个手艺人，🐶
chunks.en: @wu67 Yes, in ancient times, we were at best artisans, 🐶

chunks.zh: 首先明白自己没什么技术 真正能称的上有技术的 全世界也就那么几个 其他的都是卖力气混饭吃的不是因为你搞电脑 你就跟技术沾边很多人以为的卷技术 无非多看点文档 多知道几个 api 这叫啥技术？
chunks.en: First of all, understand that you don't have much technology. There are only a few people in the world who can truly be called technical. The others are just making a living by selling their strength. Just because you are working with computers doesn't mean you are related to technology. Many people think that pushing technology is nothing more than reading more documents and knowing a few more APIs. What kind of technology is this?

chunks.zh: 保安, 美团，滴滴，或者去制造业做 IT ？
chunks.en: Security guard, Meituan, Didi, or go to the manufacturing industry to do IT?

chunks.zh: 个人觉得，除了 steam 做小游戏，IT 人很难有什么创业方向
chunks.en: Personally, I think it is difficult for IT people to have any entrepreneurial directions except for making small games on Steam.

chunks.zh: @dmanbu 感觉这条路也不是很好走
chunks.en: @dmanbu I feel this path is not easy to take either.

chunks.zh: @fliter  创业有两种，一种是吃政策的福利，也就是上头有人。
chunks.en: @fliter There are two types of entrepreneurship. One is to benefit from policies, that is, to have someone at the top.

chunks.zh: 但这种情况对于没有人脉资源的普通程序员来说，是很难的。
chunks.en: But this situation is difficult for ordinary programmers without network resources.

chunks.zh: 另外一种就是卷技术，抢别人的饭碗。
chunks.en: The other is to push technology and steal other people's jobs.

chunks.zh: 现在是 APP 存量时代，没过硬的技术，不一定能抢过别人。
chunks.en: Now is the era of APP stock, without solid technology, you may not be able to steal from others.

chunks.zh: 有些老程序员写代码很强的，能在竞争中存留下来的，都有两把刷子。
chunks.en: Some old programmers write code very well and can survive in the competition. They all have something special.

chunks.zh: 因为对自己的要求更高一点？对自己希望更大一点？
chunks.en: Because you have higher requirements for yourself? Do you have greater hope for yourself?

chunks.zh: 初中、高中就毕业的人，老家找个厂上班，该买房就买房，该结婚就结婚，全家上下没有一个觉得买房风险大，失业了怎么办，生小孩了重复自己的人生怎么办。
chunks.en: People who graduated from junior high school or high school find a factory to work in their hometown, buy a house when they should, get married when they should, and no one in the family thinks that buying a house is a big risk, what to do if they lose their job, what to do if they have children and repeat their lives.

chunks.zh: 我觉得还是我们的预期比较高，可能我们读了大学读了研究生，自然对自己的未来期望更高。
chunks.en: I think our expectations are higher. Maybe we went to university and graduate school, so naturally we have higher expectations for our future.

chunks.zh: 老家总有厂子吧，只要手脚健康总有要我们的，it 行业打打工，有班就上，没班就回家，只要能接受这样的未来，其实日子还是很好过的。
chunks.en: There are always factories in my hometown. As long as my hands and feet are healthy, there will always be people who want us. In the IT industry, work when you have a shift, and go home when you don't. As long as you can accept such a future, life is actually very good.

chunks.zh: 我现在就是强行的让自己对未来的期望降低点，大不了我不结婚、不生小孩，大不了我直接回家打工去。
chunks.en: Now I am forcing myself to lower my expectations for the future. At worst, I will not get married or have children. At worst, I will just go home and work.

chunks.zh: @hongyexiaoqing 耗子是很优秀的技术人员，但是他这么早就英年早逝，实在是非常讽刺，很明显耗子的生活质量不怎么样。
chunks.en: @hongyexiaoqing Haozi is a very good technician, but it is very ironic that he died so young. Obviously, Haozi's quality of life is not very good.

chunks.zh: 那么，他所推崇的这条技术人员路线，真的正确吗？
chunks.en: So, is the technical staff route he advocates really correct?

chunks.zh: 如果正确，他为啥这么早就去世了？
chunks.en: If it is correct, why did he die so early?

chunks.zh: 你“回到大城市”里有，诶有跟其他行业的人交流呢？
chunks.en: Have you communicated with people in other industries when you "returned to the big city"?

chunks.zh: 做比较忌不控制变量有一出想一出。
chunks.en: It is taboo to compare without controlling variables. Think of one thing at a time.

chunks.zh: just do it
chunks.en: just do it

chunks.zh: @cong 像弗弗西斯一样每天推石上山
chunks.en: @cong Push stones up the mountain every day like Sisyphus

chunks.zh: 类似学习不只是上课，技术也不只是上班，最好分开讨论。
chunks.en: Similarly, learning is not just going to class, and technology is not just going to work. It is best to discuss them separately.

chunks.zh: 对我来说，技术没有终点，但是最好不用工作。
chunks.en: For me, technology has no end, but it is best not to work.

chunks.zh: 你看看现在各种公众号卖课的，教别人“拿高薪”的，不就是外行眼里所谓的知名技术人吗。
chunks.en: Look at the various public accounts selling courses now, teaching others to 'get high salaries'. Aren't they the so-called well-known technical people in the eyes of laymen?

chunks.zh: 卷技术的本质大多数时候其实只是舔老板的一种表现而已，不管用不用得着，用的好不好，反正能让老板开心，这一点很多行业其实都一样。
chunks.en: The essence of pushing technology is actually just a way to please the boss. Whether it is useful or not, as long as the boss is happy, this is the same in many industries.

chunks.zh: 大部分人都是混口饭吃，当然我只是表达下我了解的普通人的情况，大佬不在此范围。
chunks.en: Most people are just making a living. Of course, I am just expressing what I know about ordinary people. Big shots are not included in this scope.

chunks.zh: 我个人是打算等我 25-27 ，按自己的业余爱好去国外读个研，身边已经有不少认识的学长去日本读音乐研究生了( CS 专业但是从小学某乐器，不想干了就直接辞职了)。
chunks.en: I personally plan to wait until I am 25-27 and go abroad to study for a graduate degree according to my amateur hobbies. I already have many senior students I know who have gone to Japan to study for a graduate degree in music (CS major but learned a certain instrument since elementary school, and quit their jobs directly when they didn't want to do it anymore).

chunks.zh: 每天乐呵呵的看不出什么焦虑。
chunks.en: They are happy every day and can't see any anxiety.

chunks.zh: 放眼日本的音乐行业，基本上都是 30-50 岁开始有成就。
chunks.en: Looking at the music industry in Japan, basically people start to achieve success between the ages of 30 and 50.

chunks.zh: 已经跑路了…
chunks.en: Already ran away...

chunks.zh: 不上班
chunks.en: Not working

chunks.zh: 我的目标就是能轻松找到本职工作，不要一失业就得 gap 几个月。。。
chunks.en: My goal is to be able to easily find a job, and not have to gap for a few months after losing my job...
